name: hyperfunction
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a condition where a part of the body is unusually active or too active: Adrenal gland hyperfunction causes excessive production of one or more adrenal hormones. These compounds may be useful in treating the diseases caused by hyper-function of human immunity.
More examplesFewer examplesSome cognitive and behavioural alterations may be partly due to adrenal gland hyperfunction.These adenomas, which are relatively rare, cause enlarged thyroid gland and thyroid hyper-function disorders.McCune-Albright syndrome is a rare cause of precocious puberty that is associated with hyperfunction of the adrenal glands.
